body: You should raise an issue with heroku.  It works fine for me, Play is returning exactly the right number of bytes.  Have you been able to reproduce this anywhere other than behind the Heroku proxy?  If you can't, then the issue is not likely to be in Play, it's likely to be in the Heroku proxy.
Thanks for your feedback. The same code works well on my own server. So it maybe an issue of Heroku.

issue.title: [2.5.0] [HAProxy] Some responses are shorter than declared in Content-length

repository.name: playframework
repository.description: The Community Maintained High Velocity Web Framework For Java and Scala.

issue.body:
### Play Version

2.5.0

Older version (i.e. 2.4.6) works as expected without any problems. So workaround for us is simple: we just downgraded play.
### API

Scala 2.11.7
### Operating System (Ubuntu 15.10 / MacOS 10.10 / Windows 10)

Docker image java:8u66-jdk, Mesos, Marathon.
### Expected Behavior

Application built on play-netty-server (embedded) works as expected if is called directly (docker exposed port or when you run it locally). It returns csv plain text responses, which size might vary from 55kb to a few megabytes.

We want play 2.5.0 version to work behind LB in the same way as version 2.4.6 does.
### Actual Behavior

If we put this application under HAProxy 1.6 load balancing (marathon-lb) _some_ (like 20%) responses (plain/html, plain/text) become truncated (to approx 19kb): it is much shorter than declared in Content-Lenght header. This behavior is reproducible with Chrome (net::ERR_CONTENT_LENGTH_MISMATCH), Firefox (which is quite silent in such situations) and even curl (which also says content is shorter than expected).

HAProxy LB options were tested: keep alive, tunnel, server close -- all with same negative result.

I am pretty sure this issue is related to #5835 which is closed.

milestone.description:
- Light CMS version (proof of concept)
- Configurable facets
- Write basic documentation "How to use"
- Migration to Play 2.5 and other better-sooner-than-later code improvements.

repository.name: commercetools-sunrise-java
repository.description: The next generation shop framework by commercetools

body:
I have the same problem. I just migrated to 2.5 and in my case the reason for the content-length mismatch is that not all the promised content is sent, as you can notice when accessing it via cURL. You receive a truncated HTML and the following error:

```
curl: (18) transfer closed with 7626 bytes remaining to read
```

From the Heroku logs, I can see a H18 error, which according to [Heroku documentation](https://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/error-codes#h18-server-request-interrupted):

> The backend socket, belonging to your appâ€™s web process was closed before the backend returned an  HTTP response.

According to Heroku it would be a Play issue and this non-Heroku-related issue seems to confirm it: https://github.com/playframework/playframework/issues/5874

@joymufeng is it also true for you?
Could you guys create a demo application where the issue is reproduced?
@lauraluiz the problem with this test app is that, it's working fine, locally and even adds the Content-Length correctly. `Content-Length:99000` So it should at least be reproducible without heroku.

The content-length is always set correctly.
The issue is that on "complex" systems (that's the best I can define them, i.e. systems behind LB, reverse proxies) like Heroku, the content gets truncated because the web server seems to close the connection, thus providing content not matching the content-length.

Unfortunately I don't have more details than those about the problem ATM.

I've reproduced it locally, it seems to only happen when using HTTP/1.0:

```
$ curl -0 http://localhost:9000/getResponse?len=10000000 | wc -c
  % Total    % Received % Xferd  Average Speed   Time    Time     Time  Current
                                 Dload  Upload   Total   Spent    Left  Speed
  0     0    0     0    0     0      0      0 --:--:-- --:--:-- --:--:--     0curl: (18) transfer closed with 2571777 bytes remaining to read
7428223
```

issue.title: Ensure that connection is not closed before response is fully writen
issue.body:
The HttpStreamsHandler is notifying that a FullHttpMessage is fully sent after it's written and flushed.  The problem is, it may still be in the Netty buffers, because the OS buffers are full.  If the connection is then closed (eg, because using HTTP/1.0 with no keep alive), the close signal will overtake the buffered part of the message, resulting in an incomplete response.

This ensures that the message sent callback is not invoked until after the promise associated with the write is complete, which indicates that the message has been fully flushed to the OS buffers.

Fixes https://github.com/playframework/playframework/issues/5835.

body: Fixed in https://github.com/typesafehub/netty-reactive-streams/pull/7, I tested those changes with the app, and the problem went away.
also this is prolly duplicated with #5874
